intro: Berchemia flavescens, commonly known as the yellow berchemia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and delicate, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms. Berchemia flavescens is relatively drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils.
